premises: If a being is human, then it is mortal
conclusions: If a being is not mortal, then it is not human
incorrect conclusions: If a being is mortal, then it is human
If a being is not mortal, then it is human
If a being is not human, then it is not mortal

premises: If a person thinks, then they exist
conclusions: If a person does not exist, then they do not think
incorrect conclusions: If a person exists, then they think
If a person does not exist, then they think
If a person does not think, then they do not exist

premises: If an action is just, then it should be done
conclusions: If an action should not be done, then it is not just
incorrect conclusions: An action should not be done
If an action should be done, then it is just
If an action should not be done, then it is just
If an action is not just, then it should not be done
